title: Verizon joins in on Facebook ad boycott
text: A Facebook ad boycott gathered more steam on Thursday, when telecom giant Verizon said it would pull ads in July over criticisms of the social media giant’s failure to monitor hate speech. The “Stop the Hate for Profit” campaign had already convinced Unilever-owned ice cream maker Ben & Jerry’s to join the campaign, as well.

title: Jim Cramer: Texas' reopening pause fired up the stay-at-home stocks

title: Verizon pulls ads from Facebook over inaction on hate speech
text: Company is the biggest yet to join growing movement, which includes Ben & Jerry’s and Patagonia, to boycott the social network

title: Verizon is pulling its advertising from Facebook
text: Telecom giant Verizon said Thursday it is pulling its advertising from Facebook, in what may be the biggest brand yet to join the #StopHateForProfit boycott.

title: Verizon pauses Facebook ads amid growing ad boycott
text: Nearly 100 brands have reportedly joined effort to push Facebook  to do more to police abusive content on its platform.

title: Facebook: More companies halt advertising campaigns on Facebook
text: Anti-Defamation League CEO Jonathan Greenblatt joins Zack Guzman to address why advertisers are boycotting Facebook Ads.

title: Verizon suspends advertising on Facebook
text: Verizon Communications Inc said on Thursday it was pausing advertising on Facebook Inc following wide spread support for a campaign that called out the social media giant for not doing enough to stop hate speech on its platforms.

title: Verizon pulling ads from Facebook
text: CNBC's Dom Chu reports that Verizon is joining other companies in pulling its ads from Facebook until it develops new content policies.

title: Verizon is latest to pull ads from Facebook over hate speech, misinformation on platform
text: Facebook Inc. FB, +0.70% shares dipped 1.4% in extended trading Thursday after Verizon Communications Inc.

title: Verizon Joins Facebook Ad Boycott, Adding To Growing Backlash Against Tech Giant’s Laissez-Faire Approach To Posts
text: Verizon has joined a growing boycott of advertisers boycotting Facebook and its Instagram subsidiary after the company’s handling of objectionable posts has left many brands uneasy on the massive social platforms. “We’re pausing our advertising until Facebook can create an acceptable solution that makes us comfortable and is consistent with what we’ve done with YouTube

title: Verizon is pulling advertising from Facebook and Instagram
text: Verizon says it is pulling advertising on Facebook until the company "can create an acceptable solution that makes us comfortable."

title: Exclusive: Viber severs ties with Facebook in growing boycott
text: Service adds to firms shunning Facebook over refusal to act against Donald Trump posts

title: NAACP chief calls Facebook ‘one of the biggest threats to democracy’
text: "They are probably one of the biggest threats to democracy that we see," Derrick Johnson, the civil-rights group's president and CEO, said Thursday on MSNBC's "Morning Joe."

title: A Facebook Ad Boycott Won't Have a Big Impact on Investors
text: Some big companies are pulling their ad spend from Facebook and Instagram.

title: Here are tech companies’ plans for increasing diversity amid protests over racial inequality
text: Sparked by social protests over systemic racism, the tech industry is laying out concrete plans to increase diversity within their workforces. Here are the plans that have been publicly announced by some of the biggest names in technology.
